section_title.title: The biggest turning point in my life: <br class='tw-hidden md:tw-block'> Wonderful choice.
section_title.subtitle: FAQ

headings.content: I learned one thing about online education is that highly motivated individuals always find a way to tackle the challenge in the most creative and flexible way.

texts.content: At #VetsWhoCode, we put ourselves in learners’ shoes to understand what they want and need, to build handy options for their education and guide them to a better version of themselves. We do the hard work to pave the ways for innovative higher education with advanced delivery modalities.

From high school students, tertiary pupils, graduates or post-graduate learners, learners of any levels can easily find a suitable online program for themselves. It’s now convenient than the past to take an online course for improving the degree, becoming working professionals or pursuing a better job with valid certification… #VetsWhoCode offers a wide range of online options for students around the globe.

items.title: Who is eligible to join VetsWhoCode cohort?

texts.content: Active Duty Troops, Honorable Discharged Veterans and Military spouses.

items.title: Do I need to show any proof of eligibility?

texts.content: We ask for proof of connection to service during the initial interview process but we don’t ask for copies of it to protect your identity.

items.title: Where do I need to be currently living?

texts.content: You can live wherever you want because we are a remote program. We have students from all over the world.

items.title: What do I need to do to apply?

texts.content: You have to complete the prework to qualify for an interview.

items.title: Oh, there’s prework?  What do I do if I’m stuck on something in the prework?

texts.content: You can always reach out to us our contact form or our Linkedin Group and if you explain your problem during the interview we can give advice so you can resend.

items.title: What is the application process? When will I know I’m accepted?

texts.content: The process is once you complete the prework we set up the interview as we get closer to acceptance date. Afterwards we let you know that whether you make it or not

items.title: What is the cost to attend the program?

texts.content: It’s absolutely free for everyone that gets in. Here you pay in learning how to build and pairing on web app features.

items.title: Do you take the GI Bill? Do I need to use the GI Bill?

texts.content: There is no need to gather GI Bill resources because you don’t need them with us.

items.title: What type of computer do I need in order to be able to do the work for VetsWhoCode?

texts.content: While we try not to focus on the type of machine you have we ask that your computer be no older than five years old.

items.title: How does the mentor program work?

texts.content: We connect you to a mentor within your first month of VWC. We do this so you can have 1:1s that focus on your growth.
